lead: This week in tech highlights significant advancements in AI, new features from major platforms, and ongoing discussions around social media regulations.

stories.title: Apple Is Reportedly Making Its Own Wearable AI Pin
stories.summary: Apple is reportedly developing a wearable AI pin designed to compete with existing AI gadgets. This device, which is expected to be the size of an AirTag, will feature cameras and microphones to interact with its surroundings. The project is still in early development stages, with a potential release date as soon as 2027.

stories.title: Apple plans to make Siri an AI chatbot, report says
stories.summary: Apple is transforming Siri into an AI chatbot, aiming to enhance user interaction across its devices. This change is expected to align Siri more closely with competitors like ChatGPT. The revamped Siri may debut alongside iOS 27, with new features rolling out in the interim.

stories.title: X copies Bluesky with a ‘Starterpacks’ feature that helps you find who to follow
stories.summary: X is introducing a new feature called 'Starterpacks' to help users discover whom to follow, similar to a feature offered by Bluesky. This move reflects ongoing competition among social media platforms to enhance user engagement and streamline content discovery.

stories.title: AI-Powered Impersonation Is Emerging as a Top Cyberthreat for 2026
stories.summary: As AI technology evolves, impersonation scams are becoming a significant concern for consumers, with 68% citing identity theft as their primary worry. This trend highlights the need for enhanced security measures in the digital landscape as AI becomes more integrated into everyday life.

stories.title: Washington Is Divided on AI Chip Exports as Anthropic CEO Deems China Sales a ‘Mistake’
stories.summary: Debate continues in Washington regarding the export of AI chips, with calls for stricter regulations following concerns raised by Anthropic's CEO. The division reflects broader tensions regarding technology and trade policies, particularly in relation to China.

stories.title: Deloitte Reports AI Hasn't Delivered Expected Profits
stories.summary: A recent Deloitte report reveals that AI technologies have not yet yielded the anticipated financial returns for many enterprises. This finding raises questions about the pace of AI adoption and its integration into business strategies.

stories.title: House GOP wants final say on AI chip exports after Trump gives Nvidia a China hall pass
stories.summary: The House GOP is pushing for greater control over AI chip exports, particularly following recent decisions that have allowed companies like Nvidia to continue trading with China. This move underscores the ongoing complexities of tech policy in the current political climate.

stories.title: Todoist’s app now lets you add tasks to your to-do list by speaking to its AI
stories.summary: Todoist has launched a new feature that allows users to add tasks to their to-do lists using voice commands. This enhancement aims to improve user experience by leveraging AI for more natural interactions, making task management more efficient.

stories.title: Marshall's new Heddon hub adds multi-room audio to speakers with Auracast
stories.summary: Marshall has introduced the Heddon hub, a new device that enables multi-room audio capabilities for its Bluetooth speakers using Auracast technology. This innovation allows users to sync multiple speakers for a cohesive audio experience, enhancing the functionality of existing hardware.
